summary: CFG accurately represents the nested loop control flow structure with both outer and inner loop paths, including initialization, condition checks, body execution, and increment operations. Minor discrepancies exist in edge representation.
missing_paths: Explicit edge from node 2 to node 17 (fallthrough to invalid selector revert)
Edge from node 12 back to inner loop condition (node 8) is implicit rather than explicit
extra_paths: Node 11 contains duplicated inner loop back-edge to 0x84 which creates redundant path representation
observations: Outer loop structure correctly identified: initialization at 0x73-0x76, condition check at 0x78-0x7f, increment at 0xb3-0xbe
Inner loop structure correctly identified: initialization at 0x80-0x83, condition check at 0x85-0x8c, increment at 0xa5-0xb0
Loop back-edges present: inner loop jumps to 0x84 (node 11->8 implicit), outer loop jumps to 0x77 (node 12->7 implicit)
Overflow check for number += 1 operation present at nodes 9-10-11 (Solidity 0.8+ checked arithmetic)
Function selector dispatch correctly shows two paths: loop(uint256) at 0x0b7d796e and number() getter at 0x8381f58a
Input validation path (node 4->14) correctly handles invalid calldata length
Parameter validation path (nodes 5->6) correctly handles type validation failure
Exit condition paths correct: outer loop exit to node 13, inner loop exit to node 12
The CFG merges some sequential blocks which is a valid optimization but makes individual instruction flow less granular
